entry.title: Daniel last updated the Description of FOOBAR-869 - [Server] celeryd not picking up celerybeat jobs
entry.content:
Steps to reproduce: run celerybeat and celeryd
Expected results: celeryd will run jobs scheduled by celerybeat
Actual results: jobs are not being executed (at least on dev)

entry.title: Daniel last commented on review CR-ZAZZ-83
entry.content: Ah, ok. That's cool.

entry.title: Daniel last commented on review CR-ZAZZ-83
entry.content: Can you comment or remove these lines?

entry.title: Daniel last commented on review CR-ZAZZ-83
entry.content: Weren't you going to remove this one?

entry.title: Daniel last commented on review CR-ZAZZ-83
entry.content: I know there may not be time today to have Scott test this with the latest revisions. Has it at least been tested against a local VM in its current form?

entry.title: Daniel last commented on review CR-ZAZZ-83
entry.content: The branch is slightly out-of-date from trunk.

entry.title: Daniel last commented on review CR-ZAZZ-83
entry.content: Yeah, I think just removing it would be best for now.

entry.title: Daniel last commented on review CR-ZAZZ-83
entry.content: As it's currently configured this would break sqlplus on any of Fubar's servers.

entry.title: Daniel last commented on review CR-ZAZZ-83
entry.content: So this should be removed too. We don't want to manage where to point for their DNS.

entry.title: Daniel last commented on review CR-ZAZZ-83
entry.content: I think that's what would be cool -- maybe having a base settings that the other files include for common settings and then replacing settings.py with one for that particular environment/server. But that needn't be part of this ticket.

entry.title: Daniel last commented on review CR-ZAZZ-83
entry.content: We should remove this altogether too.

entry.title: Daniel last commented on review CR-ZAZZ-83
entry.content: We should remove this directory altogether (and the reference for it).

entry.title: Daniel last commented on review CR-ZAZZ-83
entry.content: I don't think we should be altering their DNS to use Google's servers.

entry.content:
first.last asked that these settings changes be made on trunk. 

diff --git a/apps/settings.py b/apps/settings.py
index e5c0afc..9cdc981 100644
--- a/apps/settings.py
+++ b/apps/settings.py
@@ -206,7 +206,7 @@ CI_COMMANDS = [cmd % {'PROJECT_DIR': PROJECT_DIR} for cmd in (
 DATABASES = {
    'default': {
        'ENGINE': 'django.db.backends.oracle',
-       'NAME': 'barPOS',
+       'NAME': 'ccstage',
        'USER': 'PP_USER',
        'PASSWORD': 'password',
        'HOST': '100.1.1.150',
@@ -214,7 +214,7 @@ DATABASES = {
    },
    'ship': {
        'ENGINE': 'django.db.backends.oracle',
-       'NAME': 'bar',
+       'NAME': 'ccstage',
        'USER': 'PP_USER',
        'PASSWORD': 'password',
        'HOST': '100.1.1.150',
@@ -224,8 +224,8 @@ DATABASES = {
 
 
 TRANSFER_EMAIL_SUBJECT_LINE = "Fubar bar Positive Ownership Transfer Confirmation"
-TRANSFER_EMAIL_SENDER = "ppquestions@example.com"
-DEFAULT_FROM_EMAIL = "PP_admin@example.com"
+TRANSFER_EMAIL_SENDER = "PP_Admin@example.com"
+DEFAULT_FROM_EMAIL = "PP_Admin@example.com"
 
 #Change this to modify the password reset link expiry days
 PASSWORD_RESET_TIMEOUT_DAYS = 1

Committed r1595

entry.title: Daniel last commented on FOOBAR-877 - Unblock transaction on failed email
entry.summary:
Previously if there were problems with the SMTP server (any number of issues: misconfigured, missing configuration, failing, down) and someone tried to transfer an asset the transfer would fail (because of the SMTP problem.) Now if SMTP issues are

Read more
entry.content: Previously if there were problems with the SMTP server (any number of issues: misconfigured, missing configuration, failing, down) and someone tried to transfer an asset the transfer would fail (because of the SMTP problem.) Now if SMTP issues are encountered they are logged but the transfer is allowed to proceed.
